295-d-03-17-95-PATH.Accident Cause: Other causes relating to train handling or makeup (Provide detailed description in narrative)
295-d-03-17-95-PATH.Narrative: ON 3/17/95 AT APPROX 1:36 AM, SWITCHING ENGINEER T. GUNNELL (#5405) WAS INVOLVED IN A SWITCHING COLLISION AT HCMF. MR. GUNNELL WAS TO OPERATE A THREE CAR TRAIN (882-108-847) FROM SIGNAL #106X TO TRK #14 BETWEEN SIGNAL RK-140X AND R200X FOR STORAGE. THERE WAS A LIGHT RAIN WHICH CAUSED THE RAILS TO BEWET. MR. GUNNELL (OPERATING FROM CAR #882) STATED IN HIS REPORT THAT AFTER ENTERING TRK #14 HE BEGAN APPLYING HIS BRAKES. HE THEN REALIZED THE TRAIN WAS NOT BRAKING PROPERLY. THE TRAIN WENT THROUGH THE TRIPPER AND STRUCK THE BAY DOOR TO THE MAINTENANCE BUILDING CAUSING DAMAGE OF APPROX $14,700. ANINVESTIGATION OF THE INCIDENT SHOWED TWO CARS HAD THE BRAKES CUT-OUT (108-847). THE DISTANCE BETWEENSIGNAL RK-140X AND R200X WAS MEASURED TO BE 240 FT. THE DISTANCE FROM SIGNAL R200X TO THE BAY DOOROF THE MAINTENANCE BUILDING IS 36 FT; FOR A TOTAL DISTANCE OF 276 FT. A TEST WAS CONDUCTED ON 3/29/95 ON TRK #28 WITH THREE CARS (657-172-649). THE TEST RESULTS INDICATE THAT WET RAIL AND TWO CAR BRAKES CUT OUT WILL INCREASE THE BRAKING DISTANCE BEFORE A THREE CAR TRAIN WILL COME TO A STOP (E04C). THIS IS A CONTRIBUTING CAUSE. THE PRIMARY CAUSE IS HUMAN FACTOR (H599).NoneNoneNone

195-d-03-16-95-PATH.Narrative: ON 3/16/95 AT APPROX 2:54 AM, SWITCHING ENGINEER J. TOMLINSON (#5640) WAS INVOLVED IN A DERAILMENT AT HARRISON YD. MR TOMLINSON STATED IN HIS REPORT THAT AFTER SWINGING TWO CARS TO TRK #20, HE WAS TOMOVE SIX CARS (692-144-134-604-625-704) FROM TRK #22 TO TRK #20. MR. TOMLINSON MOVED HIS TRAIN PASTINTERLOCKING SIGNAL #RC172X AT STOP. HE SAW A LIGHT TRAIN MOVING TOWARDS HIS SIX CAR CONSIST. HE MOVED THE TRAIN BACK ON TRK #22 DERAILING BOTH TRUCKS OF CAR #692 CAUSING EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO THE CAR AND THIRD RAIL. CAR #692 DERAILED APPROX 60 FT WEST OF SWITCH #175 TRAVELING 75 FT AND STRIKING TRK #23. AN ACCIDENT INVESTIGATION CONDUCTED FOLLOWING THE INCIDENT CONCLUDED THAT MR. TOMLINSON WAS OPERATING FROM CAR #704 (REAR CAR) WHILE LOOKING OUT OF THE CAB WINDOW. HE BACKED UP THE TRAIN WITHOUT THE USE OF A FLAGMAN, OPERATING THROUGH SIGNAL RC172X AT STOP. ONCE HE SAW THE LIGHT TRAIN COMING TOWARD HIM, ON THE LEAD TRK, HE PLACED THE REVERSER KEY IN THE FORWARD POSITION, APPLIED THE CONTROLLERIN THE FAST POSITION RESULTING IN THE DERAILMENT AND ASSOCIATED DAMAGE. A GOOD FAITH ESTIMATE WAS MADE TO DETERMINE THE DOLLAR DAMAGE FROM THE APPROPRIATE DIVISIONS.NoneNoneNone
